title: Calories in Guinness Stout
meta_description: Discover calories in Guinness stout per standard serving, including carbs, protein, fat, and nutrition breakdown for this popular Irish beer.
assumptions: Guinness Draught Stout, standard 12 fl oz (355 ml) serving, unpasteurized canned or draft version, no added flavors.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by type (e.g., Draught vs. Foreign Extra), serving size, and brewing batch. Check labels or brewery info when available.

quick_answer.text: A standard 12 fl oz serving of Guinness stout contains about 125 calories and 10 g of carbs.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts fields for easy comparison.

tweaks.label: For a 16 oz pint (vs. 12 oz serving)
Guinness Foreign Extra Stout (higher ABV) per 12 oz

faqs.q: How many calories in one Guinness stout?
faqs.a: About 125 kcal in a standard 12 fl oz serving.

faqs.q: What are the carbs in Guinness stout?
faqs.a: Approximately 10 g of carbohydrates per 12 fl oz, mostly from malted barley.

faqs.q: Does Guinness stout have any protein or fat?
faqs.a: Yes, about 1 g protein and 0 g fat per serving.

faqs.q: How does serving size affect calories in Guinness?
faqs.a: Calories scale with volume; a pint (16 oz) has around 167 kcal.

faqs.q: Is Guinness lower in calories than other beers?
faqs.a: Yes, at 125 kcal per 12 oz, it's relatively low compared to many lagers (140â€“150 kcal).
